content.en: Transfusion prediction: Researchers are exploring the use of predictive modeling and machine learning algorithms to improve blood transfusion practices in various medical procedures. These algorithms are being used to predict the need for transfusion in elective surgery, hospitalized patients, knee arthroplasty, pelvic fracture patients, liver transplantation surgery, cardiac surgery, and more. By analyzing preoperative and intraoperative data, these algorithms can identify risks of postoperative complications and predict the need for transfusion, potentially improving patient outcomes and reducing the need for unnecessary transfusions.
content.da: Transfusionsforudsigelse: Forskere undersøger brugen af prædiktiv modellering og maskinlæringsalgoritmer for at forbedre blodtransfusionspraksis i forskellige medicinske procedurer. Disse algoritmer bruges til at forudsige behovet for transfusion ved elektiv kirurgi, indlagte patienter, knæalloplastik, bækkenfrakturpatienter, levertransplantationskirurgi, hjertekirurgi og mere. Ved at analysere præoperative og intraoperative data kan disse algoritmer identificere risici for postoperative komplikationer og forudsige behovet for transfusion, hvilket potentielt kan forbedre patientresultaterne og reducere behovet for unødvendige transfusioner.
